intro: Ixia seracina, commonly known as the seracina lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its bloom period occurs in late winter to early spring, adding color to the landscape during the cooler months. The flowers are often pale yellow to orange, with a distinctive, narrow corolla.
